ECSchema.description: Base schema for the Earthwork domain.

ECEntityClass.description: A bis:PhysicalElement created by earthwork activities to build subgrade or a part of a structure above it (such as “soft” courses in pavement or ballast), or to raise the level of ground in general. Usually formed by spreading and compacting construction materials such as sand and gravel.
Defines a shared set of properties and classification (the 'type') that can be associated with a ew:Fill instance.

ECRelationshipClass.description: Relationship indicating the bis:PhysicalMaterial used by a particular ew:FillType.
A type-instance relation; one that indicates that the specific ew:Fill is an instance of the defined ew:FillType.

ECEntityClass.description: A bis:SpatialLocationElement modeling the resulting void from a modification of existing terrain by bulk excavation of material.
Defines a shared set of properties and classification (the 'type') that can be associated with a ew:Cut instance.

ECRelationshipClass.description: Relationship indicating the bis:PhysicalMaterial being removed by a particular ew:CutType.
A type-instance relation; one that indicates that the specific ew:Cut is an instance of the defined ew:CutType.

ECEntityClass.description: A bis:PhysicalElement capturing the target grade of ground after introducing modifications to the existing terrain.
Defines a shared set of properties and classification (the 'type') that can be associated with a ew:SurfaceGrade instance.

ECRelationshipClass.description: A type-instance relation; one that indicates that the specific ew:SurfaceGrade is an instance of the defined ew:SurfaceGradeType.

ECEntityClass.description: A bis:SpatialLocationElement utilized to hide an area of existing terrain in order to prevent visual conflicts with proposed changes to it.
